I really does controls my congestion and post-nasal drip and the nausea I experienced because of the post-nasal drip. After 3 months of use, I am experiencing swelling just about every where, even my face. I have a stuffy nose and experiencing some weight gain, even though I have increased my activity level. column9: I have recently been diagnosed with sever Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I'm nauseous on a daily basis, whether I take Promethazine (generic for Phenergan) or not. But if I combine the Promethazine with Librax for IBD, it usually helps. But it seems taking just one or the other isn't enough, I usually need both. The only problem with Promethazine or Librax, is they both cause a lot of drowsiness. Sometimes even taking both of those together it doesn't help. So I take lots of ginger tablets, and drink lots of Ginger Ale and Ginger Tea. I suggest for anyone with IBS or IBD to take Promethazine, and possibly even Librax. Just make sure you have someone else to drive, otherwise stay home!

19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was first prescribed this for nausea and vomitting, and it worked wonders. Bit of sleepiness the first couple times I took it but after a couple days I felt surprisingly less sedated than I had been led to believe going on the pharmacists word and the reviews I have read. The sleepiness was really not all that bad, GREAT for helping me fall asleep, not too hard to stay awake and alert once you know your personal tolerance to it, the right dosage and ANYONE can go take a nap from this medicine, however the 25mg dosage I take does not overwhelm me with tiredness. I have continued to take it for allergies, help with calming and sleep, as well as for odd here and there nausea I still get. Has also worked surprisingly well by itself in treating mild pain (and obviously taken with an opiate pain killer it will potentiate the effects however it was a somewhat effective mild pain medicine on its own) So my overall personal view on this medication is that it is great, however everyone will experience it differently. I can say though that the pros for me at least have outweighed by a long shot any mild side effects I experienced and have been safely and effectively taking it for a few different problems without any real side effects noticable by myself or my doctor. Would greatly reccomend for nausea. Would also reccomend for allergies. I broke out in severe hives and once again this medicine stepped in to prove extremely effective. Truly in my opinion a versitile drug with many indications.

(Patient)
iamcbh, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: A few weeks ago, I became extremely ill.  At first, I thought that it was indigestion.  After several hours of horrific abdominal pain, I assumed that I had food poisoning.  Prior to this, I could count on two hands the number of times I have vomited in my life.  For about 12 hours, I endured the worst pain, nausea and vomiting that I have ever experienced.  I couldn't even keep a sip of water or ginger ale down.  Finally, I went to the emergency room.  I was writhing in pain and severely dehydrated.  When I was admitted, I was given an IV with fluids for my dehydration, dilaudid for the pain and promethazine for the nausea/vomiting.  What a relief!  Less than five minutes after the promethazine was administered, my nausea completely subsided and the dilaudid was working well for the pain.  After tests and an ultrasound, I was diagnosed with gallstones.  I was given a prescription for 25mg promethazine, along with hydrocodone for my pain.  The pill form of promethazine has been just as effective for me as it was when I had it via IV.  Last week, I had my gallbladder removed and the surgery went well.  I have taken the promethazine in conjunction with my pain meds to prevent further nausea.  The only noticeable side effect is the drowsiness.  Honestly, I like that this makes me drowsy, as I battle insomnia and this helps me sleep.  Sleeping is important regardless, but especially since my body is recovering from surgery.  I would recommend promethazine to anyone that is experiencing nausea!  It was truly a life-saver for me when I was feeling the worst I have ever felt.  I know that I have had promethazine prior to this, as it is mixed with codeine in prescription cough syrup.  That combination has been effective in the past for anytime that I had a serious chest cold with a nasty cough.  Terrific medication in my opinion.

column9: I have a Terminal Illness and suffer from chronic Nausea, I was started on this medication but in it's brand name (Phenergan), about 12 to 15 years ago and have gotten my RX's filled with the brand name or this name over all those years and it has worked for me each and every time.This Med. can cause drowsiness when you first start taking it.  So be careful for the first a few days to a week or so, if your going to take it long term then your body should adjust it the Meds and the drowsiness will get less and less every time.Like I said before, 15 years or so later and it's still the only thing that works each and every time I use it.  I would never ask for or use anything else for Nausea.  The best part is I never knew it worked on Motion Sickness, another problem I now get as well, Woo Hoo I'm going to bet it'll work... So look for my UPDATE when I get to try it for that too.  Good Luck and You All Feel Better.  God Bless,Father Tony

The first time I took it, I took it in the morning and I slept the whole day through.  I would only wake up to use the bathroom.  It felt as if someone was draining me of all my energy--not a good feeling.  Right now I'm trying to stay awake on my job; it's about 8:30 p.m. and I took the pill last night at around 11:30 p.m.  The lasting effect this drug has is horrible--over 20 hrs. later and I'm still sleepy.  I don't think I'll be taking this drug again.

column9: This is a wonder drug! If I become nauseas or even start to feel nausea coming on, I take this and it is gone. I never take a whole pill. A 1/4 or 1/2 does the trick for me. I also use it for motion sickness which I have had all of my life.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Promethazine is my miracle pill!  I'm a diabetic and take it for nausea due to extreme blood glucose fluctuations.  I also take it to relieve the nausea that comes with my migraines.  Promethazine has been administered to me via IV when I've been hospitalized for diabetic ketoacidosis which causes me to vomit violently and even have dry heaves.  It totally relieves any nausea have have, regardless of its cause.  Other anti-nausea medications have triggered itchy, twitchy reactions or have done nothing at all.  When administered through an IV, it makes me extremely tired, but when taken orally, it doesn't make me sleepy at all.

column2: jimmypop, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this medication is used often with pain medication to increase the delivery and strength of the pain medication. its main purpose is nausea caused by anything. i will quarentee it will help anybody with nausea. as others have said though, this medication can make you VERY sleepy. i know a lot of medications say that, but this drug WILL make you want to sleep no matter who you are. so keep that in mind.

column2: Buzz, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given promethazine for a stomach and vomiting.  It worked good, make me very sleepy.  This drug works to relieve the symptions, not cure the cause.  Keep taking it for a few days at least.

column2: sarduchie03, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: While taking very strong Pain Pills, I would get an upset stomach. Once this was added to taken 30 minutes before the pain pill, it was as if all the stomach cramps and upset stomach never came back !!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Please be careful when taking this druf that you don't combine it with Demerol. I was in the ER with severe abdominal pain and vomiting. The nurse gave me Promethazine for the vomiting and Demerol for the pain. 24 hours later I was back in the ER due to a reaction of the meds mixing together and all of the muscles in my body were contracted. I couldnt move, my toungue swelled up and filled my throat and my jaw tightened up so far that I had a hairline fracture when all was said and done. It was very scary, and if I wouldnt have known, I would have asked them to just let me be sick! Please be careful and ask about drug interactions.

column2: ScotishKnight, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken Promethazine tablets, IM injections and the compounded gel for almost 15 yrs. I am constantly nauseated, suffer from anxiety, and motion sickness, however, this drug does the trick!. It eases my panic attacks, prevents nausea and vomiting from motion sickness, and WORKED GREAT when the family was down with that 5 day stomach bug.I was a bit nauseated throughout it, but never threw up! I like the ease of the gel for my kids when they are sick at their stomachs. It no longer makes me sleepy, but it does relax me a bit. The shots are a hassle because you develop little lumps at the injection site if you don't exercise and drink lots of fluids, and the only other drawback is, that if I take very many in a day on an empty stomach it can make your stomach feel on fire. Works great tho' all in all, but if you can take it with food, or even milk, the nausea will go away, and it will definately prevent vomiting!
